docs.text: capsule : the verma family is having a wedding and all the relatives will come for the multi-day festivities .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: mira nair's film is pleasant enough with a little human drama , a few family secrets , some sadness and some happiness .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: you have seen it all before , but perhaps not from india .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the photography is colorful and the music is very agreeable .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: mira nair previously directed salaam bombay and mississippi masala .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: her newest film , written by sabrina dhawan , is very similar to previous films like betsy's wedding but it is set in new delhi .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a wealthy family is having a wedding .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: an indian wedding is a multi-day affair as much a family reunion as a nuptial .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even more than in the us , it is an excuse for a lavish and extravagant family get-together .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film shows us what the family does together and at the same time follows several family members' individual story lines .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: aditi verma is marrying hemant , an indian engineer working in the us .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she had previously had a relationship with vikram , her supervisor .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: latit , her father ( played by naseeruddin shah ) , is juggling many problems , not the least of which is worrying about the caterer has hired pk dubey .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: dubey is a rather eccentric man with a taste for eating the marigolds he uses for decoration .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even dubey will soon be romantically entangled when he becomes interested in alice , one of the family servants .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: several family members arrive giving rise to several plotlines involving sex , family secrets , or both .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are heartbreaks and there are people falling in love .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: some of the subjects covered are probably near taboo for indian films .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: western audiences will appreciate a look at unfamiliar indian customs like women painting their hands with henna .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: on the other hand it was not clear ( to me at least ) if scenes like the family singing together are typical of indian culture or if they are a convention of indian musical films .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this seems a particularly westernized family with the father wearing american designer sweaters and the family speaking mostly english .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the latter will , however , help with an international release .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sabrina dhawan's screenplay is vibrant with witty dialog .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we have seen films with plotting very much like this , but the indian setting makes a great deal of difference .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: director mira nair calls the film an affirmation of life .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i rate it a 7 on the 0 to 10 scale and a low +2 on the -4 to +4 scale .
docs.label: positive
